newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Gevaert surges on Almanij/Cobepa deal.
newsitem.headline: Gevaert surges on Almanij/Cobepa deal.

text.p: Shares in Belgian holding company Gevaert rose nearly 18 percent to a new (post-1994, six-for-one stock split) life high of 3,520 Belgian francs on news the company's assets were to be divided between the Almanij and Cobepa groups.
Under the complex transaction due to be carried out over the next three months, Gevaert shares will be split in two and shareholders will receive a "new" Gevaert share and a Cobepa share.
The new Gevaert shares can be swapped immediately or in three years into Almanij shares.
Both Almanij and Cobepa surged on news of the deal, which was announced Friday when the companies' shares were suspended, hence lifting the value of Gevaert.
